{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=1960 |Team=Wyoming Cowboys |Image= |ImageSize = |Conference=Skyline Conference (Mountain States){{!}}Skyline Conference |Division= |ShortConference=Skyline |Record=8-2 |ConfRecord=6-1 |CoachRank= Not ranked |APRank=Not ranked |HeadCoach=[[Bob Devaney]] |OffCoach= |DefCoach= |OScheme= |DScheme= |Stadium=[[War Memorial Stadium (Wyoming)|War Memorial Stadium]] |Champion= |BowlTourney= |BowlTourneyResult= }} The '''1960 Wyoming Cowboys football team''' represented the [[University of Wyoming]] in the 1960 NCAA football season. The Cowboys offense scored 212 points while the defense allowed 71 points. Led by head coach Bob Devaney, the Cowboys finished the season with eight wins. Running back Jerry Hill was in his final season and finished his Cowboys career with 1,374 rushing yards on 288 carries.<ref>http://www.wyomingathletics.com/trads/hof-1993.html</ref> ==Schedule== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style="background:#593D2B;color:#DDCCA5;" | '''Game''' || '''Date''' || '''Opponent''' || '''Result''' || '''Cowboys points''' || '''Opponents''' || '''Record''' |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 1 || Sept. 17 || Montana || Win || 14 || 0 || 1-0 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 2 || Sept. 24|| New Mexico || Win ||13 || 3 || 2-0 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 3 || Oct. 1 || @ Arizona|| Loss ||19||21|| 2-1 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 4 ||Oct. 8 || Denver || Win || 41|| 2|| 3-1 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 5 || Oct. 15|| @ Colorado State || Win || 40||8|| 4-1 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 6 || Oct. 22 || Air Force || Win || 15||0|| 5-1 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 7 || Oct. 29|| Utah || Win || 17 || 7 ||6-1 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 8 || Nov. 5 || @ Utah State || Loss || 13 || 17 || 6-2 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 9 || Nov. 12|| @ Texas Tech || Win || 10|| 7|| 7-2 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 10 || Nov. 19 || @ Brigham Young || Win || 30 ||6 || 8-2 |- align="center" bgcolor="" |}<ref>http://cfreference.net/cfr/school.s?id=442&season=1960</ref> ==Awards and honors== *Jerry Hill, All-Skyline Conference Running Back ==1960 Team Players in the NFL== The following were selected in the [[1961 NFL Draft]].
